item.title: "mad men" actress pregnant, father not revealed
item.description: actress january jones, who plays sullen housewife betty draper on the emmy-award winning television drama "mad men," is about to become a single mother, people magazine reported thursday.

item.title: islamic trusts could revive gulf property market
item.description: jordanian ashraf hamdan began investing in dubai's real estate market in 2006, with a few modest rental investment forays before turning his sights on flashier projects as a wave of luxury developments hit the market.

item.title: microsoft demonstrates windows phone updates
item.description: microsoft announced updates to its windows phone platform, adding new multitasking features and giving developers broader access to hardware functions.

item.title: robert stempel, an engineer who led g.m., dies at 77
item.description: mr. stempel, who succeeded roger smith as chief executive in august 1990, was a mechanical engineer who helped develop the catalytic converter.

item.title: coffee may reduce stroke risk
item.description: drinking coffee appears to offer protection against stroke, a major study of women out thursday concludes.

item.title: dish to take over about 500 blockbuster leases
item.description: blockbuster's soon-to-be parent will help keep some stores open.

item.title: berlusconi sex trial opens, immediately adjourned
item.description: italian prime minister silvio berlusconi's trial on charges he paid an underage teenager for sex opened on wednesday and was adjourned until may 31 after a hearing that lasted just 10 minutes.

item.title: saab's on the ropes after chinese bailout deal falls apart
item.description: saab slid back to the brink today after its deal for a cash infusion from china's hawtai motor group fell apart. saab hasn't made a car since ...

item.title: lewis hamilton chasing canadian hat-trick
item.description: mclaren's lewis hamilton can make amends for his ill-disciplined monaco weekend with a montreal win on sunday, even if red bull's sebastian vettel is the man with the momentum.

item.title: tunisia postpones election, possibly aiding new parties
item.description: the interim tunisian government cited technical problems as the cause for the delay ' a decision that will likely lead to a reshuffling of tunisian political dynamics.

item.title: gus johnson joins fox sports
item.description: the announcer known for his excitable style will call college football and basketball and n.f.l. games.

item.title: baker wants to crumble plan for cookie reality show
item.description: a woman in new york city who runs a baked goods-shop called "one tough cookie" filed a trademark suit in federal court on wednesday to stop the food network from airing a new bakery-based reality show called "tough cookies."

item.title: guilty-by-association: growing up in hell of north korean gulag
item.description: kim hae-sook was only 13 years old when she was dragged off to a north korea prison camp for nearly 30 years, punished along with the rest of her family simply because her grandfather fled to rival south korea in the 1960s.

item.title: north korea holding 200,000 political prisoners: amnesty
item.description: north korea is holding around 200,000 people in huge political prison camps where inmates are forced to work in conditions approaching slavery and are often tortured, amnesty international said on tuesday.

item.title: 30 seconds with jim thompson: with jim thompson
item.description: jim thompson has written eight books on youth sports, including the recent 'elevating your game: becoming a triple-impact competitor.'

item.title: google-ita decision may be just days away: source
item.description: the justice department is close to a deal that would allow google inc to buy an airline ticketing software company while requiring that the software remain available to google rivals, according to a source close to the deal.

item.title: southwest: steady force helps kansas navigate a rough patch
item.description: earlier this season, the kansas junior forward marcus morris made a promise: "getting to the n.c.a.a. tournament is not good enough," morris said.

item.description: from the times's choice blog: the latest batch of figures on the number of applications, and acceptances, at 100 colleges and universities around the country this year.

item.title: heat go 3-1 up with overtime win over bulls
item.description: the miami heat beat the chicago bulls 101-93 in overtime on tuesday to take a 3-1 lead in the eastern conference finals and move one win away from a place in the nba finals series.

item.title: peru's keiko fujimori widens lead in presidential race
item.description: right-wing lawmaker keiko fujimori may be pulling away from leftist ollanta humala 10 days before peru's june 5 presidential run-off and a gaffe by a top aide has not hurt her, a poll showed on thursday.

item.title: peru's presidential race nearly tied: ipsos poll
item.description: right-wing lawmaker keiko fujimori is virtually tied with left-wing former army officer ollanta humala a week before peru's june 5 presidential run-off, a poll by survey firm ipsos showed on sunday.

item.description: although the nintendo 3ds makes it retail debut in six days, curious video game players can get an early peek at the device today.

item.description: even with snowstorms shutting down airports nationwide, u.s. airlines reported no flights with delays of more than three hours.

item.title: peter thiel tells why he will pay you to drop out of school
item.description: peter thiel, the technology entrepreneur and venture capitalist, tells cnbc why he is giving $100,000 to 24 young adults to stop going to school and start focusing on building the tech companies of tomorrow.

item.title: yao ming brings swift end to sneaker dynasty
item.description: china's nba all-star yao ming has sued a chinese sportswear maker over alleged name and image infringements, local media reported friday.

item.title: a royal wedding, a tarnished crown
item.description: for many in britain, the upcoming royal marriage is seen less as a rite of renewal and more as a step toward saving a sullied monarchy ' and an uncertain step, at that.

item.title: europe: more bodies recovered from 2009 air france crash

item.title: wings rally in third to stay alive against the sharks
item.description: the detroit red wings scored three unanswered third-period goals and had 39 saves from goalie jimmy howard to beat the san jose sharks 4-3 on sunday and keep alive their nhl playoff series.

item.title: yemen opposition transition plan awaits saleh answer
item.description: yemen's opposition proposed a transition plan on saturday which would see president ali abdullah saleh hand power to a vice president while steps are taken toward a national unity government and new elections.

item.title: in abidjan streets -- looting, scramble for water
item.description: looters and desperate residents scrambling to find water occupied the otherwise deserted streets of abidjan on thursday after a week of fighting for control of ivory coast's commercial capital.

item.title: saudi and allies focus on yemen's saleh exit

item.title: the lede: libyan dissident says she was beaten in qatar
item.description: eman al-obeidy, a libyan woman who said that she was gang-raped by members of col. muammar el-qaddafi's security forces in march, was expelled from qatar on thursday, and arrived in libya with bruises and scars.

item.title: two protesters die, hundreds hurt in yemen clash

item.title: for california, a slower-growing population
item.description: in the last decade, california experienced its slowest growth in state history, census figures show.

item.description: israeli troops opened fire on sunday at palestinian protesters in syria who rushed toward a border fence and syrian state television said six demonstrators were killed.

item.title: yemen's saleh again rejects move to replace him
item.description: protests in yemen descended into violence on friday in which at least five people were killed and dozens wounded as president ali abdullah saleh rejected a gulf arab plan to secure an end to his 32 years in power.

item.title: "american idol" king of tv advertising revenue
item.description: "american idol" is the darling of tv advertisers, dwarfing other tv shows by raking in an estimated $7.11 million every half hour last year for the fox network, according to a forbes.com survey.

item.title: florida doctors defend right to discuss guns with patients
item.description: a group of florida physicians filed a federal lawsuit on monday seeking to overturn a new state law that limits doctors' ability to ask patients about guns in the home.

item.description: an explosion at an iranian oil refinery during a visit by president mahmoud ahmadinejad on tuesday killed two people and injured 12, the mehr news agency said.

item.description: the company is beginning an effort that aims to cast the brand in a contemporary light by marketing to bikers and going to rallies.

item.description: the basic truth about how the world economy is working today is being ignored by most of the politicians in the united states and denied by many of its leading businesspeople.

item.title: in the fluid 'arcadia,' joy is the constant
item.description: time may be muddled in this revival of tom stoppard's play, but the human condition, not to mention outstanding theater, aren't.

item.title: over 100 militants attack pakistan's northwest
item.description: around 150 militants armed with rockets attacked a security checkpost in pakistan's waziristan on thursday, killing eight soldiers, intelligence officials said, as tensions rise in the volatile northwestern region along the afghan border.

item.description: a gunman opened fire in an elementary school in rio de janeiro and at least 13 people are dead, authorities said.
